# Introduction

This section provides a list of common questions related to characterization of land cover disturbances in a watershed of interest. Questions, the purpose for asking them, and associated resources are listed below. 

## Key questions

### What recreational opportunities exist in the watershed?   
  + **Purpose:** Identify sites of high value or which may be of high recreational value in the future
  + **Resources:** 
      + [iMap BC](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/data/geographic-data-services/web-based-mapping/imapbc)
  

### What recreation infrastructure is present in the watershed?  
  + **Purpose:** Identify existing sites of high importance
  + **Resources:** 
    + [Sites and Trails BC](http://www.sitesandtrailsbc.ca/)
    + [iMap BC](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/data/geographic-data-services/web-based-mapping/imapbc)

### Are there known sites of cultural significance to First Nations?  
  + **Purpose:** Identify watershed areas of high cultural importance
  + **Resources:** 
      + [First Nations Profiles Interactive Map](https://geo.aadnc-aandc.gc.ca/cippn-fnpim/index-eng.html)
 
  
### Whoâ€™s traditional territory does the watershed of interest fall in?  
  + **Purpose:** Important regarding consultation for projects 
  + **Resources:** 
     + [Native Land Digital](https://native-land.ca/)
      
    

### Do treaties or other agreements with First Nations exist for this watershed? 
  + **Purpose:** Important regarding consultation for projects and for understanding land rights in the watershed
  + **Resources:** 
    + [BC Treaty Commission](https://www.bctreaty.ca/map)
